CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 5, 1952, pg. 2 reads: "Honored On Retirement - When William E. Hill of Elmore Square was retired by the Embassy Apartments in Mount Lebanon after twelve years of service, the tenants of the luxury apartment, in appreciation of Mr. Hill's courteous and efficient service, presented him with numerous gifts and a scroll signed by all of the apartment dwellers containing the inscription. "A Good Janitor Never Dies, He Merely Fades Away." Shown presenting the scroll to the retiring janitor are Mrs. John McEwen and Mrs. J.P. Jones, members of the committee which was headed by Mrs. E.J. Laughlin, and was responsible for organizing the good will gesture among the tenants. - Harris PHoto."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Mrs. John McEwen presenting retirement scroll to janitor William E. Hill, with Mrs. J.P. Jones looking on, posed in Embassy Apartments, Mt. Lebanon, another version
